content: This (#17176) is a reviewed PR for integrals/integrability with .re. This is needed for a formalization of the Beta distribution in probability and was recommended by @Etienne Marion to be submitted in a separate PR first. If a maintainer could take a look at reviewing/merging this, that'd be great!

I am looking at this now. (I am not a maintainer, but I am a regular reviewer who has contributed to this part of the code fairly often before, so I'm hoping a review from me will speed up the process.)
Just to be clear, non-maintainers are welcome to, and even encouraged to, submit reviews for mathlib PRs!

I'm a bit confused with how the Lean review process works still? My understanding was that after at least one review (not necessarily from a maintainer), it's ready to be looked at by a maintainer for merging. I already have one approved review on this PR, so what's the best course of action typically?
A review from a maintainer is better than a review from a reviewer than a review from someone else than no review at all
Are you talking about the mathlib review process? Right now there are over 1000 open PRs so the way it works is very slowly
Yes, I mean the mathlib review process sorry. Got it, will be patient :working_on_it:
